snippet: Construction on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge had motorists prepared for the worst on Sunday, with many using different routes into New York City.
abstract: Traffic seems to flow normally on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge, which connects Manhattan and the Bronx over the Harlem River, despite construction that had motorists prepared for horrendous traffic jams on the George Washington Bridge; restoration of the bridge, budgeted at more than $400 million, is expected to continue through the end of 2013.
lead_paragraph: Construction on the Alexander Hamilton Bridge had motorists prepared for the worst on Sunday, with many using different routes into New York City.

headline.seo: Alexander Hamilton Bridge Construction Has Drivers Bracing for Worst
headline.main: Bracing for Big Traffic Jam That Didn’t Come on Day 1
headline.print_headline: Bracing for Big Traffic Jam That Didn’t Come on Day 1
